alert.note: Alert for Cambria; Cameron; Clearfield; Elk; McKean; Potter; Somerset; Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 18 at 2:47PM EST until February 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...West winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Warren, McKean, Potter, Elk, Cameron, Clearfield, Cambria and Somerset Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 7 PM EST Saturday. Dangerous snow squalls with high wind gusts are most likely during the early morning, while the strongest wind gusts will occur during the late morning into the early evening. * IMPACTS...Poor travel conditions due to blowing snow. The wind could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and perhaps dangerous snow squalls will occur in the early morning hours. Light snow showers are also expected to return after noon. Blowing snow and reduced visibility can be expected during and after snowfall.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. For high wind safety information, visit weather.gov/wind. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
